from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
import os
import re
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.site_utils import SiteUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.storage.storage_utils import (
    StorageUtils,
)
from havoc.lib.filesystem_actions import FilesystemActions
from havoc.lib.decorators import ignored
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.test_utils_base import TestUtilsBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.filesystem_utils import FilesystemUtils
import time
import json

LIB_PATH = "havoc/autoval/lib/test_utils/fio/jobfile_templates"



[docs]class FioRunner(TestUtilsBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self, host, args):
        logdirs = SiteUtils().get_log_dirs()
        self.tmp_logdir = logdirs["control_server_logdir"]
        self.dut_logdir = logdirs["dut_logdir"]
        self.ignore_remote_fio_error = True
        self.host = host
        self.args = args
        self.files = args.get("files", None)
        self.drive_interface = args.get("drive_interface", None)
        self.drive_type = args.get("drive_type", None)
        self.drives = args.get("drives", None)
        self.old_host = AutovalUtils.get_host()



[docs]    def test_setup(self):
        self.install_fio()
        self.job = self.create_fio_job(
            self.host,
            self.files,
            self.drive_type,
            self.drive_interface,
            self.drives,
            self.args["replace_values"],
            self.args["template_file"],
            self.args["filesystem"],
            remote=False,
        )



[docs]    def install_fio(self):
        AutovalUtils.set_host(self.host)
        AutovalUtils.install_rpms(["fio"])
        AutovalUtils.set_host(self.old_host)



[docs]    def get_drives(self, host, drive_type, drive_interface, drives):
        drives = []
        test_drives = AutovalUtils.run_on_host(
            host,
            StorageUtils.get_test_drives,
            drive_type=drive_type,
            drive_interface=drive_interface,
            drives=drives,
        )
        drives = test_drives.keys()
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Available drives: %s:" % (drives))
        return drives



[docs]    def create_filesystem_mount(self, host, drives):
        for device in drives:
            mnt = "/mnt/fio_test_%s" % device
            FilesystemUtils.mount(
                host,
                device,
                mnt,
                filesystem_type="xfs",
                filesystem_options=" -K -i size=2048",
            )
            df = FilesystemUtils.get_df_info(host, device)
            AutovalUtils.validate_equal(
                df["type"], "xfs", "Mounted %s at %s" % (device, mnt)
            )



[docs]    def create_fio_job(
        self,
        host,
        files,
        drive_type,
        drive_interface,
        drives,
        replace,
        templ_filename,
        filesystem,
        remote,
    ):
        """
        Gets the list of test_drives on dut based on options passed i.e,
        drive_type, drive_interface, all_block devices = True or False and
        any special drives passed
        Creates a new job file based on the 'template' file and the test_
        drives list got above
        @param templ_filename: Path to file containing job definition
        Takes default if nothing is passed
        @replace: List of key / value pairs to replace in template file
                additional imputs for fio can be given as key value pair
                in the name 'additional_fio_options'
        """

        if not files and not drives:
            drives = self.get_drives(host, drive_type, drive_interface, drives)
        filesystemactions = FilesystemActions()
        templ_path = filesystemactions.get_file_path(
            os.path.join(LIB_PATH, templ_filename)
        )
        with open(templ_path, "r") as fp:
            content = fp.read()
        additional_fio_options = replace.get("additional_fio_options", None)

        if additional_fio_options:
            del replace["additional_fio_options"]

        for key, value in replace.items():
            regex = re.compile(key, re.MULTILINE)
            content = re.sub(regex, str(value), content)

        if additional_fio_options:
            for key, value in additional_fio_options.items():
                content += "%s=%s\n" % (key, value)
        idx = 0
        dev_str = content + "\n"
        if files:
            dev_str += "[job%d]\n" % idx + "filename=%s\n" % (files["file"])
            drives = ""
        if filesystem:
            self.create_filesystem_mount(host, drives)
        for device in drives:
            if filesystem:
                dev_str += "[job%d]\n" % idx
                dev_str += "filename=/mnt/fio_test_%s/file1\n" % device
            else:
                dev_str += "[job%d]\n" % idx
                dev_str += "filename=/dev/%s\n" % str(device)
            idx += 1
        job_file = self.tmp_logdir + "/" + templ_filename
        dest_job_file = self.dut_logdir + "/" + templ_filename
        with open(job_file, "w+") as prep_f:
            prep_f.write(dev_str)
        if not remote:
            with ignored(Exception, exception_string="already exists"):
                host.put_file(job_file, dest_job_file)
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Job file used is at: %s" % (dest_job_file))
        return dest_job_file



[docs]    def run_fio_on_dut(self, host, job, opts=None, remote=False):
        ret = False
        output_file = (
            self.dut_logdir + "/" + "fio_{}_{}".format(host.hostname, int(time.time()))
        )
        tmp_output_file = (
            self.tmp_logdir + "/" + "fio_{}_{}".format(host.hostname, int(time.time()))
        )
        cmd = "fio %s --output-format=json --output %s" % (job, output_file)
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Running FIO using command: %s" % (cmd))
        if opts:
            cmd += "%s" % (opts)
        out = host.run(cmd, get_result_obj=True, timeout=28800)
        cmd_out = out.stdout
        exit_code = out.return_code
        # setting timeout to 8 hrs
        if not remote:
            host.get_file(output_file, tmp_output_file)

        if exit_code != 0:
            ret = self.parse_fio_error(exit_code, cmd_out, tmp_output_file)
        else:
            ret = True
        AutovalUtils.log_info("FIO output file is copied at: %s" % (tmp_output_file))
        return ret, tmp_output_file



[docs]    def start_test(self):
        ret, tmp_output_file = self.run_fio_on_dut(
            self.host, self.job, opts=None, remote=False
        )
        self.fio_file = tmp_output_file
        return ret, tmp_output_file



[docs]    def parse_fio_error(self, exit_code, cmd_out, fio_output_file):
        """
        This method parses and checks through each job
        of the fio output file you provide as input and check
        if there are any errors in each job executed
        """
        fio_out = ""
        if os.path.isfile(fio_output_file):
            with open(fio_output_file) as file_obj:
                fio_out = file_obj.read()
                # Ignoring if "timeout on cmd SEND_ETA" while FIO
                # Parse Error from fio Output to ignore such error
                # if ignore_remote_fio_error set to true in control file
                # Until we find issue why SEND_ETA happens in FIO client/server;
                # we were ignoring it raising error during test
                if self.ignore_remote_fio_error:
                    output = re.search(r"timeout on cmd SEND_ETA", fio_out)
                    if output:
                        AutovalUtils.log_info(
                            "SEND_ETA timed out with exit code: %s, \n cmd_out:- %s"
                            % (exit_code, cmd_out)
                        )
                        return True
                # Parse error code in fio command output
                m = re.search(r"error : (\d*)", fio_out)
                if m and m.group(1) == "0":
                    return True
                else:
                    raise TestError(
                        "FIO Failed, \n cmd_out:- %s, \n log file:- %s"
                        % (cmd_out, os.path.basename(fio_output_file))
                    )
        else:
            raise TestError("FIO Output File Not Found")



[docs]    def parse_results(self, print_result=True):
        """
        Parses fio JSON result file
        @param path: Path to JSON file with results
        @return: Dictionary with key / value result pairs
        """
        with open(self.fio_file) as fp:
            results_data = json.load(fp)
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Parsing results from json (%s):" % (self.fio_file))
        fio = {}
        perf = {}
        fio["fio_version"] = results_data["fio version"]
        # Saving the Input
        fio.update(
            AutovalUtils.add_dict_key_prefix(results_data["global options"], "opt_")
        )
        fio["result"] = []
        jobs = results_data["jobs"]
        for job in jobs:
            _job_data = {}
            _job_data["error"] = job["error"]
            _job_data.update(
                AutovalUtils.add_dict_key_prefix(job["job options"], "opt_")
            )
            for rw in ["read", "write", "trim"]:
                if job[rw] is None:
                    continue
                elif "runtime" in job[rw] and job[rw]["runtime"] == 0:
                    continue

                jobname = job["jobname"]
                perf = {}
                for field in ["bw", "bw_agg", "bw_max", "bw_min", "bw_mean"]:
                    perf["%s (Kb/s)" % field] = job[rw][field]
                    _job_data["%s_%s" % (rw, field)] = job[rw][field]

                for field in ["iops", "total_ios"]:
                    perf["%s" % field] = job[rw][field]
                    _job_data["%s_%s" % (rw, field)] = job[rw][field]

                for lat in ["mean", "min", "max"]:
                    if "lat_ns" in job[rw]:
                        _job_data["%s_%s" % (rw, field)] = job[rw]["lat_ns"][lat]
                        perf["lat_%s (nsec)" % (lat)] = job[rw]["lat_ns"][lat]

                if print_result:
                    AutovalUtils.log_info("\n%s -- %s" % (jobname, rw))
                    AutovalUtils.log_info(
                        ", ".join(
                            "{}: {}".format(key, value) for key, value in perf.items()
                        )
                    )
                fio["result"].append(_job_data)
        return fio
